metadata.title: CVE-2021-32028 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in postgresql. Using an INSERT ... ON CONFLICT ... DOUPDATE command on a purpose-crafted table, an authenticated database usercould read arbitrary bytes of server memory. The highest threat from thisvulnerability is to data confidentiality.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32028` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 10.17-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libecpg6 - 10.17-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 10.17-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpq5 - 10.17-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-10 - 10.17-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-client-10 - 10.17-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plperl-10 - 10.17-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython-10 - 10.17-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-10 - 10.17-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-10 - 10.17-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-10 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.17-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
